Reviews.Title: “Satisfied”
Reviews.Author: Sport127
Reviews.Content: Overall, we were satisfied with this hotel and would stay here again but wouldn’t be our first choice in the future. Our shower had a tough time producing hot water and the water wasn’t draining properly in the tub. I was standing in a lukewarm shower while standing in 3 inches of water. Not very nice… We let the staff know and they offered alternated showering facilities and comped our parking which was a fair trade. Pros: Our room was clean and a decent size, beds were firm and comfortable, the staff was delightful and there was a flat screen TV and a refrigerator in our room. Cons: While the location of this hotel is in Downtown Vancouver, there are a lot of other hotels (within the same price range) in the downtown core that are more central. Parking is $27 per night which is far too expensive for the location of this hotel. Our room looked out over a busy street and there was very little sound proofing on the windows. My wife kept asking if I was sure I closed the window because it sounded like the cars were in the room with us (I had closed the windows).

Reviews.Title: “It's dirty.”
Reviews.Author: TorontoTravellingbug
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for four nights in April 2012 and found my room was filthy – dust everywhere; my TV remote was caked with old dirt and the bathroom vanity/pullout mirror was covered in other womens' makeup – nauseating. Every day I put the mirror and turned it at an angle to draw attention to how dirty it was, and every day it was put back as though it was actually clean. I mentioned it to the manager on my way out who said he'd be addressing the problem. Let me know your thoughts on Room 818 in that case. This may just be a case of too few staff cleaning too many rooms in too short a time, but it has really affected my view of the hotel. If that's the dirt I can see, where else are they cutting corners? Also to note, the computer and internet access are $3 for 15 minutes on an old, old system. Pretty cheap for a hotel catering to business travellers to charge for use of an old version of Microsoft Word, in my humble opinion. That said, good location and price for what you get. Just don't expect the service and sophistication that is promised on the website.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go for the wine!”
Reviews.Author: catp79
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Executive Hotel in September 2011 for 3 nights. Our other accomodation fell through so we literally walked in and booked there and then. The staff were extremley friendly and helpful and couldn't do enough to accomodate us. The room was fine, spacious with a very comfy bed. The bathroom was a little tired though and in need of a refit (especially the leaky sink), and the view wasn't great. We didn't sample the room service but we did try out the wine "tasting" hour...disappointing. We were given 1 very small glass and a few crisps and then basically ignored. When you compare this to Kimpton wine hours, you end up feeling a little cheated. However, don't let this take away the fact that this is a nice hotel in a great location close to the boat to Granville Island (not cheap) and plenty of resteraunts and shops.

Reviews.Title: “Location great, wine tasting not as expected”
Reviews.Author: Dusrin F
Reviews.Content: Great location...adequate rooms, friendly staff Now we booked because we were intrigued by the wine tasting aspect. If this is why you are booking, stop and rethink. The wine tasting comprised of a bartendress, myself, my wife and a small glass of Jackson triggs Merlot. Now I love my wife, and the bartendress was concise, but the wine tasting was literally just that, " here is a taste of JT, now on your way..." Would stay again, but would not do it for the wine...

Reviews.Title: “Great staff!”
Reviews.Author: Darin J
Reviews.Content: The staff here was wonderful. They helped fix a parking ticket when I foolishly forgot to put our permit on the dash and got us a great rate when we needed to extend our stay an extra night. We had a 7th floor room with 2 double beds. The room wasn't huge, but it was big enough for two adults and an energetic 11 year old! Location is excellent--only a 2 block walk down to the water and close to lots of restaurants. The hot tub on the 9th floor was great--the only time there were no towels available, a quick call down to the office had them restocked before we got out of the tub.

Reviews.Title: “Mini Vacay with hubby”
Reviews.Author: MichelleD1973
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great. Great staff, great room, great food. The only downside was the bed. It was so hard, and they use flat sheets instead of fitted so every time we turned over the sheet would come off. Frustrating. We woke up every morning with sore backs. The hotel itself is very quaint and clean. The mini bar is super expensive though, so stay away from that. All in all I would totally recommend The Executive Hotel Vintage Park.

Reviews.Title: “Ten out of Ten!”
Reviews.Author: QualicumBeacher
Reviews.Content: Lovely bright hotel in a perfect location! Welcoming, helpful staff. Very clean, beautiful room with 2 queen beds, firm & comfortable, with a super view of the ocean! Great price with free wired internet, robes, toiletries, coffee & tea ~ lots of pillows & towels! Close to the Granville Island water taxis and 4 terrific Irish Pubs! We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Garima G
Reviews.Content: The room was tiny. The hair dryer was not working. Location is great but otherwise quite a let down.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, great price.”
Reviews.Author: bellis_coldwine
Reviews.Content: I stayed here two nights recently and will definitely book again. -The location was excellent, walking over to Granville Island was a nice day trip. -The staff, as noted by several other reviewers, are really just lovely. Our fridge didn't work when we checked into the room and that was promptly fixed. Everyone is very courteous and pleasant. -Outdoor jacuzzi was well used by us. Other then not having any towels stocked, it was a great relaxing space. -Bed was rather comfortable, the pillows lack any support, but there are plenty of them so we just doubled up. -View was non-existent from our room but that's not a complaint, just noted. This hotel was exceptionally quiet, I remarked on that several times throughout our stay. -Check in/out was smooth and overall I felt like I had great value for my money. I'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Average... but you're not really in the city for the hotel anyways... are you?”
Reviews.Author: redrocketgirl21
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel and it was okay. I say okay, there wasn't anything REALLY wrong with it, but it was all the 'little' things you know? We ended up changing rooms as the first room we were given (we booked online), was tiny and had a really big old eyesore of a house right outside the window that really looked like a deathtrap and needed to be torn down. This room was so small, we could barely move around the double beds. The faucet leaked and water spewed out all over the counter. We were moved without any issues, to a room facing the front which had a slightly better view, but a bit more noise (wasn't a problem though). Room cleanliness, was OK, ( I did find some gum on the carpet which remained there throughout our stay even though I'd mentioned it, so that didn't really impress me all that much). The rooms had full stocked mini bar, but no corkscrew, and the bell hop had to come up and open our wine for us. For a wine 'themed' hotel, I was surprised by this. The wine tasting..... well.. we never got to go to this even though we were there 3 nights, as it was at a VERY awkward time, and only for one hour, between 5-6. I would suggest it be a bit longer (2-3 hours would have been perfect)... you could have come back from a full day, had a nice glass of wine, then got ready and headed out again for the evening. We used the fitness facilities here... not too bad, and the view was good. The elliptical trainer's computer didn't work, so you could USE it, just not know exactly what you were accompllshing. They had a water cooler up there for guests, however, there were NO disposable cups (shame, because who brings there water bottle on vacation?) Jacuzzi was great.... nice and hot.... however the jets didn't work :( The beds were small. My cousin and I each had a double bed, but you definitely would NOT book this room for 4 adults... the beds were hard and I don't think they actually had boxsprings, just some kind of hard platform that squeaked when you moved on the mattress. The ;staff were helpful at this hotel, but it didn't really 'knock my socks' off you know? It wasn't bad, but it was the little things overall that just kind of added up.... including having to call down to the front desk for more toilet paper...... I think we'll try another hotel next time, unless they can fix some of the 'little' things........

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, GREAT staff”
Reviews.Author: Bill M
Reviews.Content: Everyone at the front desk was very friendly and very willing to help us with directions or recommendations for dinner, etc. Room was the smallest I have ever stayed in but there was a nice large Jacuzzi tub. Room was clean and quiet. Heater and A/C worked great. Nice location next to Granville St. Bridge. We were able to walk to shopping. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: franzipan87
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. Close to Granville Island via water taxi and short walk to all the main attractions. The wine reception in the evening was great especially with a vine yard representative turning up.Giant Jacuzzi bath was also amazing and much appreciated after a day of walking the city in the rain!! All in all a very relaxing experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Concierge”
Reviews.Author: Brittani E
Reviews.Content: They had very nice rooms , at this hotel and it was very close to alot of stores, we were in town for a concert and had called a taxi, the front desk was being very helpful but we had been waitin awhile. they had callled back 4 times and it was almost time for us to be their so the front door man Albert was not at all happy and gave us a ride in the hotel car, this hotel has very very nice staff and we would definately stay again

Reviews.Title: “Good location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: tezza B
Reviews.Content: Likes: Situated in the "less touristy" end/side of downtown, near the Granville Bridge, but just a short bus or complimentary courtesy shuttle ride to the more touristy northern end (it only about 20-25 minutes brisk walk from one end to the other). Close to a sky-train stop (best way to get from airport to hotel). This "False Creek" end of town was more in touch with the local "Vancouvorites". Handy to inexpensive restaurants and "take-outs". Very friendly staff - could not do enough for us. We had a room on the main arterial route side the first night and one of the windows would not latch properly (faulty latch). As the latch could not be repaired immediately the Hotel management relocated us to a room which was just as nice but on the quieter side of the building. Great jacuzi on roof. The glass of complimentary wine at 5pm was a nice touch. General: Rooms a little on the small side. Dislikes: Nil - if something needed adjustment (i.e. more fresh towels needed in the jacuzi), then the staff would resolve ASAP.

Reviews.Title: “We liked the location”
Reviews.Author: Jozcat
Reviews.Content: We found it easy to get here from the train in from the airport. We had a three night stay and found the staff very helpful - the shuttle service into town was great and the location close to bus stops made it really easy to get around. On our first night we had a room facing the freeway and because the window didn't lock shut properly it was a little noisy - but as soon as we notified the office we were offered another room straight away and it was no problem. The rooms aren't huge but they are comfortable. We enjoyed the wine reception on one of our days there - nice to come back to the hotel after a busy day and have a glass of wine. So many great Japanese restaurants and other places to eat nearby and we took our sushi takeaway down to the park at False Creek and felt like locals.

Reviews.Title: “Love the apartment suite”
Reviews.Author: Oscar J
Reviews.Content: My female friend and I stayed for 3 days. Love every bit of it. First time to Van, eventhough I'm from Texas. We where close to all the stores and close to the bay, by walking distance. We walk everywhere. I planned on going again and bring friends too. Next time I have to get the 2 bdrm suite. That's a must!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Vancouver Trip”
Reviews.Author: Al F
Reviews.Content: Professional staff - very knowledgeable, helpful and friendly. Small rooms but everything I needed was available - beautiful view - good TV channel selection, convenient to my work walking distance across the bridge), great running area, many restaurants and pubs. Restaurant is nice - great wine-tasting in early evening. Gym is functional, and jacuzzi available.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and good location”
Reviews.Author: grant_SK
Reviews.Content: Stop overnight in Vancouver for changing the airplane, I booked this hotel through hotwire, this hotel locates in the heart of downtown Vancouver, great location, the room is a little bit smaller but the view is good, sit in the room with a couple of coffee and watch the bridge and cars outside the window, great relax, pretty quiet, no noise at all. I will certainly come back.

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive hotel that's a lot more run down than photos show.”
Reviews.Author: midwestjetset
Reviews.Content: The photos for this hotel imply that it is upscale, but that is not the case. It's not expensive, the staff is friendly and competent, and it's not too far away from the city center, but that's the end of the favorable parts of this review. The hotel mostly looks like it was nice, once, maybe in the early 80s. But, maintenance has been lacking: the walls in the hallways and elevator could use painting, rooms look old and out of date. The images that they show on their website are all of the honeymoon suite (which they don't tell you), but even that room (which they gave us for a small upgrade charge after we complained) was only just average. The biggest complaint is probably noise: walls are very thin, so anytime someone walks down the hall or opens the door to their own room, it sounds exactly like someone is walking into yours, which can be startling. Also, the heating/AC unit is very loud and sounds like there are some marbles rolling around in there. This was true both of the original room we had and later the honeymoon room. Overall, it's not a bad hotel for the price, but don't let the name fool you into thinking it's anything classy. Comparable to a Quality Inn or something of that nature (2 star).

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in an Interesting Location”
Reviews.Author: Grums
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights over Christmas and was very pleased with their rates that included secure underground parking. We were warmly welcomed however I had asked/requested for 2 adjoining rooms as we were traveling with my 85 year old mother. This was not provided and the rooms given were down the hall instead. I thought since I booked weeks in advance this would not have been a difficult request. The rooms are small but well equipped with a fridge in a dresser/desk unit, queen bed, side tables, one chair and standing reading lamp. Lots of windows which does have great views of the water but also the Granville bridge and traffic. This can be noisy if on that side. Ask for the quiet side. The location is at the edge of downtown but we liked it as it is only a few blocks from the sea walk and to the boat shuttle to Granville Island which is perfect for breakfast, shopping or just wandering for a few hours. We would stay again. Enjoyed the hotel and rates were great for this caliber of hotel in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Tough to beat the combination of value & location”
Reviews.Author: groundskeeperwilly
Reviews.Content: Vancouver is a great city to explore on foot, so being situated within a ten-minute (or less) walk to both Robson Street and Yaletown, The Executive is conveniently located for those wanting to shop or experience some of the great restaurants in the area. Very friendly staff and very clean reception, elevator and hallways. Room was clean and comfortable, with all amenities one would expect. I arrived several hours before the posted 'check-in' time and was pleased to find the staff more than accommodating in arranging an early check-in, which was much appreciated, as I've found this to sometimes be an issue at other hotels I've stayed in in Vancouver. Overall, fantastic value for dollar, will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms but at a small price (and amazing customer service)”
Reviews.Author: anniebsea
Reviews.Content: Two weeks ago a few friends and I had a girls weekend and stayed at the EVP Vancouver. I was mostly attracted to this hotel because of the price (under one hundred) and the free parking voucher I obtained. I also don't book a vacation without consulting strangers on Trip Advisor! This hotel was in a great location a few blocks off of Robson and close to Yaletown. It is almost tucked under a bridge (quiet). The hotel itself is nice but not 5 star - it hardly has a lobby, the walpaper is peeling in the halways and the rooms are small. It does have some nice touches though - flat screen T/V, an outdoor whirlpool (not working) all rooms were named, and we recieved a newspaper. The reason I am giving this hotel 4 starts and not 3 is the customer service we recieved. We were greeted with a friendly face, we were allowed to keep our car in the garage until 3 PM instead of having to move it at check out, and most importantly - my friend left something that had sentimental meaning to her in the room and we called when we returned to Seattle and the staff went so far as to search through trash to find it! It was found an Fed Exed to her the following day! Now that is customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Downtown Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Kathy M
Reviews.Content: Rooms are a little small but we felt this hotel was a very good value for downtown Vancouver. The staff were nice and the complimentary wine tasting was a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressed”
Reviews.Author: Eleanor W
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel for 6 nights on a recent trip to Canada and the US, this was one of the best hotels by far, the room was clean and met our needs, we ate in the Hotel restaurant a couple of nights and had breakfast every morning which was wonderful. The staff were all very friendly and most helpful, we plan to visit Vancouver again in a year or so and Vintage Park will be our home away from home again.

Reviews.Title: “I needed a nap after staying here”
Reviews.Author: mandyy403
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed a this hotel for one night. First impression of the hotel was good as the lobby is very nice and the front desk agents are very professional and welcoming We booked the parking package, which allowed us to park without having to spend the $27 it normally costs. The bad thing with this is that there aren't enough parking spots in the underground lot. We went out friday evening and got back to the hotel around 10pm and had an impossible time finding parking. We lucked out when someone left, but had that not happened, i'm not sure where we would have parked. There doesn't seem to be any parking around the hotel, so i'm a little curious as to where we would have went The rooms are very small and kind of an interesting shape. There are floor to ceiling windows, which depending on you room, allows for very nice views The bed was comfortable, but we didn't have a good sleep. Every so often throughout the night it sounded like a jet engine was in our room. The furnace or air kicks in and woke us up each and every time. Both of us are really good sleepers and can usually sleep through anything... not with this! The noise was bad. The sirens at 6am also didn't help - You are downtown though, so it's bound to happen The room and bathroom were clean, except for the rack that holds the towels. It had rust all over it and looked like it hadn't been cleaned in a very long time. This is minor compared to what it could have been, but its definitely something I noticed within the first few seconds of entering the bathroom. I'm not sure if I would return to this hotel as i've definitely stayed in better ones in Vancouver. I booked this hotel because we wanted to be close to Granville Island and surrounding areas, which we were.. the hotel is in a great location. I would honestly spend a little bit more money and stay somewhere else, you might have a good nights sleep elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, cheap and central”
Reviews.Author: canadian_2
Reviews.Content: What more could you want.? I would want a computer to check my email but other than that, this place is fine. Nothing fancy, but parking was included, the location was excellent (a bit away from the downtown noise but only a 5-10 minute walk to Robson st.) and everything was clean and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Basic rooms are basic, upgraded apartment room worth it”
Reviews.Author: TheRanj
Reviews.Content: Had a stay here last night and had the 2 bed room booked first. The rooms were very small and as noted in other reviews, the beds are even smaller. We upgraded to a 2-bedroom apartment on the 11th floor and were very happy with this room - a King bed in one room, double in the other, and a pull-out sofa in the living room and full kitchen + washer and dryer. The hotel is a 10 minute walk to the heart of Yaletown, which is why we booked this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Lauren L
Reviews.Content: I'm currently at this hotel. It is certainly not what we expected from the photos/reviews. I have three nights booked. When I walked in I stated it did not meet my minimum standards and asked for a refund as I wanted to transfer to a hotel. They refused to give me a refund and kept two nights of the three-night stay as a penalty. I understand a one night penalty (which is pretty standard at most hotels). I'm trying to not let this ruin my vacation but I am very upset. Please do not stay here. The beds are uncomfortable, the rooms are outdated, the restrooms remind me of dorm rooms, the TV screens are no larger than my laptop screen and there is no wireless in the rooms. I made a very bad mistake selecting this hotel without knowing the facility. Please do not do the same.

Reviews.Title: “August Family Break”
Reviews.Author: riverlife
Reviews.Content: Stayed in August with family. Great location and next to the excellent Granville island. Hotel was close to everything to see in downtown Vancouver and was very good value for a family room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with good location.”
Reviews.Author: Tammy H
Reviews.Content: We travel to Vancouver for the weekend a couple times a year. This is a nice hotel with everything you need and centrally located so you can walk to just about everything. Close to the skytrain station as well which made our last trip especially easy.

Reviews.Title: “Staff makes the stay worthwhile!”
Reviews.Author: CanMom1
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the apartment suites as I was there for a long stay. I didn't get to see the hotel rooms. I would definitely recommend this hotel for long stays. The room has a complete FULL kitchen and washer/dryer. We were treated so well by the hotel staff and were made to feel completely at home. Location is excellent! Within walking distance to many restaurants on Davey. Shopper's Drug Mart is 2 blocks away and a few grocery stores within 6 blocks. Granville Island is a 2 block walk to the ferry and then a 2 minute ferry ride. Again, the staff is so friendly and helpful and I can't say enough good things about them. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet clean rooms - close to the waterfront”
Reviews.Author: Michelle P
Reviews.Content: I was traveling on business, and find it difficult to sleep in hotels, not this one! Actually slept past 7 am for the first time in months. Rooms are clean and the beds are awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Good size rooms, balcony hot tub, clean, friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: Live2travelneat
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights walking distance to Granville island, Stanley park, downtown if <40 and of average fitness but otherwise taxis are very reasonable to all locations!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it.”
Reviews.Author: Christopher H
Reviews.Content: Loved the hotel. Not sure what some people are looking for at this price. Large room, great service, brill location. Will definitely stay here again when next in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Tired Pricey Hotel Unobviously Located at the Far End of Howe Street”
Reviews.Author: MissHK2009
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 2 nights here at single room. With such price C$136 per night (breakfast excluded), one has a plenty of choices in the neighbourhood actually. From airport, you can take the sky train to Yaletown station from where you can reach the hotel on foot within 15 mins. This hotel is not obvious as it's blocked by the adjacent large complex Quality Hotel. Situated at the end of Howe Street, it lacks of quality restaurants or shops in the neighbourhood, mainly to-go Pizza shops along Granville Street which is next to Howe St. The elevating Granville Street Bridge is in the front of the hotel, so some traffic noise is expected in the room. Rooms dated, clean enough though. Staff ok. Overall, not fantastic, location no good, I do not recommend this at all.

Reviews.Title: “Just stayed in Sept.”
Reviews.Author: Client N
Reviews.Content: This is a nice location for the hotel. It's a 20 minute slow walk to the water at English Bay. However, the bed was as hard as a rock. We would have been better off sleeping on a table. Also, they charged us $27.00 to park one night. There are plenty of hotels in the area which would also be in a good location; therefore, I'd say try another. We complained of the hard bed and were offered a free breakfast. We declined. We'd rather a good nights sleep, thanks. Also, the tray the coffee and cups sat on were very dusty. We complained about that too. Over all, what we thought would be a reasonalbe rate turned out to be more expensive with the huge parking rates. They are not the Westin and even they don't charge that much if you park your own car.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: lina L
Reviews.Content: I am currently staying in your hotel and the room is fine. However your restaurant is horrible -- the food is terrible, the service is awful, and when I ask for fresh dessert, the waitress tells me the desserts are frozen, they are microwaved -- are you serious -- I just had the Wild BC Salmon and that was disgusting -- sitting on only 2 tbsp of rice, fish smelled awful. I will never eat at your hotel restaurant again -- you need better food on your menu.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel ever. Short staffing in every department.”
Reviews.Author: Mlee2
Reviews.Content: Staying for 2 night. Restaurant was pack of people with only 2 servers in n out. Server told me after, they have to wash dishes too. That's y server uniform was wet. Getting out from the evaluator, hallway was dirty with cobweb just like a motel in a scary movie. Try to go dinner in the restaurant, one server working as a bartender, hostess, serving, running room services. What the owner thinking!!! Try to phone the front desk for a towel, no one answer my call for over half an hour. End up have Went down to front desk myself, seems short of staff there as well. don't tell me this is 4 star hotel. I did work in a 4 star hotel before. This hotel Even worst than a motel by a countryside freeway. the only good things in this hotel is the staff is so friendly, like the poor asian server work at night been running like a dog but he still had a smiling, welcoming face. I knew he did try his best but the owner if this hotel been cheap to hiring staff to keep a service standard.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, friendly staff...”
Reviews.Author: joce45
Reviews.Content: Nice clean hotel with very friendly staff!! The room was too small though but you get what you pay for. I booked through Hotels.com and got the room for cheap so can't complain when you get to stay in downtown Vancouver for a good price. I would stay here again. Walking distance to alot of good places.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the food and service”
Reviews.Author: Michael H
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel over the recent holiday weekend to visit family in the area. This is not our first stay at this location - about our sixth time - and it will not be the last. Why - the service is first rate and the food served in the restaurant is great - served with a smile and good value. The rooms only have queen sized beds - not a show stopper - as the other features in the room make up for it completely. More about the service - the front desk and housekeeping provided to our every expectation and need - not that we are demanding guests - more on the lines - we expect things to be in place without asking. This is the level we received. I do on a regular basis travel for work and I get to see a full range of hotels - some brand new and others at the tired end. This hotel is coming up for a face lift, in my opinion - but the staff do care and maintain it in a very exceptable condition. Free Internet - check with your room rate - I think on most rooms its included - it was with our booking.

Reviews.Title: “large hotel rooms when with kid's”
Reviews.Author: pinotn
Reviews.Content: we love this hotels 2 bed room suites, lots of space for the 4 of us, the staff is also verry helpfull. to go to Grandville island you just have to take the litle boat over the inlet. we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Our entire experience was absolutely fantastic”
Reviews.Author: jayjjaxon
Reviews.Content: Albert the concierge and the Romance pkge made our date in the city even more memorable. Honeymoon Suit with jacuzzi tub in the room was beautiful and the Valet parking was a fantastic touch. Only complaint was the construction across the street which can't be helped by them.

Reviews.Title: “You can't beat the location”
Reviews.Author: Todd2PS
Reviews.Content: I was a litle bit worried when I read some of the other reviews. So I was even more impressed with this Euro style hotel with the best location ever. The location can't be beat whether you have a car or not. You can easily walk to everything in downtown Vancouver. The rooms are on the small side, but make up with a refrigerator, free Internet, coffe/tea, and a whole wall of windows that open to the fresh air. I really liked the layout of my room since I could wake up facing outdoors. OK, parking is $27/day, but you really don't need a car in Vancouver. I even liked the fancy soaps and creams in the bathroom. I like lots of towels since I like to take a shower before going out in the evening. There could have been another set of towels in the bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Kind of pricy for what you got.”
Reviews.Author: jenandjer
Reviews.Content: My girlfriends and I went downtown for a ladies night again. It's prime season in Vancouver so we know that we couldn't luck out on Priceline again and get a great 4 * + room for a good value. This room was two full beds for 176 + taxes. Firstly I get that it's on Howe St, however the parking was outrageous. 31 dollars a night. How can I stay at more exclusive hotels right downtown and it's cheaper? The room we had was very small. Very good prices on the mini bar if you are into that.. My gf's and I just bring mixers from home as we generally go out to a nice place for dinner and then go to the club afterwards. The hotel definitly is in need of an upgrade. Wall paper everywhere, old carpet everywhere and chipped paint peeling from the baseboards. It was definitly an old timer, but appeared to be clean. The mattress and pillows were awful. I've stayed at Ramada's that were more comfortable. I've stayed in an Executive brand hotel before which I believe the one in Harrison Hot Springs is - total luxury compared to downtown Vancouver ! The pillow was the worst. I could have called for a new one, but it was 230am by the time we got back to our hotel room so I didn't want to nag. The mattress was really really firm. Overly firm and very low to the ground. I felt like I was living at home again sleeping on my mattress I had when I was 12. Overall, when I go downtown and pay this much for a 3 star I really didn't expect this. I get it's not spacious I get it's not upgraded or newly rennovated, but I expect it to atleast be comfortable and to have a good nights sleep and not feel guilty about possibly looking for somewhere else to park.

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: ReddevilNewport
Reviews.Content: my wife and i stayed here for 10 days in July and August when visiting our son in Vancouver. The hotel is in a great location near to False Creek and Granville Island and only two blocks from Granville Street and the nearby shops and restaurants. The walk to Canada Place and Gastown takes about 15 to 20 minutes. The rooms are a good size and are very comfortable. Despite some of the reviews by others the beds are very comfortable. The staff are helpful and friendly and we would stay here again. A realy nice hotel. Vancouver is a great city and it is easy to get around on public transport using the Skybus, city buses and the sea bus. If you visit this wonderful city make sure you see Gastown, False Creek, Stanley Park and Granville Island. Also make sure that you visit Grouse Mountain and Whistler, both are wonderful and will take your breath away.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & Amenities”
Reviews.Author: YEGcg
Reviews.Content: We visited Vancouver for the August long weekend. Since we wanted to save on our food budget, having kitchen facilities was a must. The room came with a FULL kitchen - stove w/ oven, fridge w/ freezer, dishwasher, glassware, utensils, etc. Small food markets were nearby. A nice amenity was the in-suite clothes washer & dryer. The room (a 2 bedroom suite; one room with a Double bed, the other with a King bed) was great for our group of 2 couples - there were 2 full bathrooms (one with shower, the other with shower/tub), great closet space, comfortable living/dining space (3-seat sofa, reclining armchair, desk w/ chair, large flatscreen tv, etc.). Note to travelers from outside North America : a Double bed does not mean 2 beds. The furniture and decor was functional and comfortable. The beds did not seem to be as hard as other reviewers have mentioned. As for the wine theme of the hotel, besides the wine sample in the hotel lounge/restaurant (which we didn't go to), there was no other wine "theming" we noticed. I'm not certain what the expectation of the other reviewers was...perhaps a fully stocked wine cabinet in each room?(There are liquor stores within a 5 minute walk that sell wine, beer, etc.) Given that the hotel is located in an urban environment, 100s of km away from any vineyards, I'm not sure how it could be more wine "themed". The location was excellent; within a 5 minute walk to convenience stores, coffee shops, English Bay, restaurants, nightclubs, etc. The proximity to the Granville street bridge made me glad that we were on a high floor - although if we had always kept our windows closed, we wouldn't have noticed any traffic noise. There was no room attendant on the second day of our stay - which was a little disappointing. We just threw our towels in the dryer to compensate. The price was reasonable, given the downtown location (C$313/night, including taxes). Parking was an additional C$27/night (including taxes). After finding out that the density of Vancouver is nearly the same as New York City, I accepted that rooms would be a little pricier than other cities. (Nearby/comparable hotels were about C$150-200/night + taxes for rooms with one queen bed and without the extra amenities & space). Overall, we'd stay as part of a group again.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended Hotel in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: travellerde33
Reviews.Content: Small, but nice room. Excellent service. In 10 minutes walking distance to downtown. Parking fees as always in this area very high, 27 Canadian Dollar per night, but the car was parked in a gated garage and access was permitted only with your room card.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, great location!”
Reviews.Author: budafudawuda
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my mum last year whilst on holiday from Australia. The staff were friendly. My only tip (no pun intended) would be for staff to bear with people who come from non-tipping countries. Vancouver was the first stop on our trip, and there were some embarrassing/awkward moments. I think maybe a "guide to tipping" in the bedrooms would be a big help. We stayed in two different rooms during our stay. The first was spacious and comfortable and clean. The second (after we'd returned from a night in Victoria) was clean and comfortable, but much more cramped. But we were only there the night, so no big deal. The location was good, and we were able to be collected from our hotel for all the different tours we did. The wi-fi was a bit intermittent. All in all, I was happy with my experience and I'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wasted Location”
Reviews.Author: zuppa7
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my wife and two kids while in Vancouver for business. The location is fantastic, everything else about this hotel is horrid. The room we stayed in was supposed to be an extended stay suite. It was poorly equipped, broken pots, 3 glasses, not enough cutlery, no can opener, and on and on... The beds gave me a back ache that I am still recovering from, not to mention how dirty everything was. The bathroom was poorly cleaned and had dirt there probably from the building's construction. The window in our unit was broken (could not open). I will stop the ranting and simply say, DO NOT STAY HERE. The staff was sincere and approachable, but upper management has yet to understand proper communication and negotiation with guests. Overall, there is so much potential to this hotel, I feel sad writing this review, but until someone with a vision runs it, travelers should avoid it.

Reviews.Title: “Location decent, hotel very dated”
Reviews.Author: cwilton27
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had just done 2 nights in Seattle and 3 nights in Portland prior to our arrival in Vancouver. All 3 hotels we stayed in were purposely "boutique" style hotels because we generally enjoy this type of place. Well, we hit 2 out of 3. Unfortunately, this was not one of the 2. Everything from the carpet to the the furniture and drapes were extremely dated. (The shower curtain also would not stay shut while showering and the shower pressure was the hardest I have ever experienced - a little painful, actually). I felt like we were back in the 70's. The room was extremely small and we had an awful view from our 3rd floor room. We attempted to change rooms for a better view, but were changed to a 7th floor room with not much more of a view but much more highway noise. It was somewhat convenient to walk everywhere we wanted to go which was nice, but if I make it to Vancouver again, I would spend a little more money to get a hotel that has done something to upkeep the property a little better.

Reviews.Title: “Worst beds ever.”
Reviews.Author: FragBunnie
Reviews.Content: The place is clean and the staff friendly enough, but the beds are bricks. I knew we were in for a long night when I first sat down on one. I've spent plenty of time in hotels from Motel 6 to the Fairmont, and I've never ever slept on a harder bed. Ever. For the money, I wish we'd gone someplace else, maybe even spent a couple bucks more... I won't be back to any Executive property.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good, if you like a HARD bed.”
Reviews.Author: sbdex
Reviews.Content: Stayed a few days with my family and some friends. The hotel was clean and people at the front desk were helpful. No Wi-Fi in the hotel rooms, which surprised me, but there was an ethernet connection. Hot tub was too hot, and pretty uncomfortable to sit in for more than a couple of minutes, but the view from there was good. The beds were really hard, and I couldn't sleep until I was so exhausted that there wasn't any choice. They told us that the parking was $20 a night, but failed to mention the extra eight dollars for taxes, which annoyed me. I prefer to know the whole price

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Downtown location, Clean & Tidy”
Reviews.Author: AusTravel888
Reviews.Content: [Party: 2 Adults, on 17yo daughter): We booked on-line in November 2010 for a July 2011 stay. On-line response was very good with plenty of feedback. We arrived on the red-eye flight out of Honolulu arriving ion Vancouer at 0545. Took a cab to the hotel (about $30). Hotel staff were very courteous and friendly (even at that time of the morning) and the concierge immedaitely assisted us with our mountain of bags.there was not one suggestion of a problem to leave our bags in secured lock-up. Check-in is normally at 2pm but they said they could have a room ready for us at 10am. As it turned out, we decided to go to Grouse Mountain straight away (an absolute must do. especially with kids....worth every cent ....but be aware it's close to an all day outing) so by the time we got back to the hotel, it was late afternoon. Rooms were clean and tidy beds very comfortable and all was nice and quiet during the evening. Service excellent. With the $9.00 per day for all travel on all public transport (buses, seabus, trains/subway) the location of the hotel is just fine ...even though it's downtown...but, it's right on the other side of the Granville St bridge, opposite Granville island Markets and only 5 minutes easy walk downhill to the nearest train station. Can park your rental car in the secured carpark but does cost $20 per day. All in All....pretty good hotel and very reasonable price. On tip though....book on-line as it is cheaper. Don't forget to add 12% Tax to your calculation as the quoted prices are exclusive of tax.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Berkshiregal56
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the EHVP. We were there for 9 nights and it felt like being at home (except not having to work)! We stayed in a 2 bedroom/1.5 bath apartment with great views of the city skyline. it was very comfortable for the two of us. Although the 2nd bedroom was a bit on the small side with a double bed. The master bedroom had a king size. I can't say enough about how wonderful the staff was at this hotel. Special kudos to Albert and Jennifer, without whom, we would have been lost. This hotel is very centrally located, so everything is within easy walking distance. It is very comfortable and nicely appointed. We were steps from trendy Davie St. and Yaletown, about 2 blocks from the sea wall and False Creek. A short Aquabus ride to Granville Island (visit the Dockside Brewery there!) We had stayed in the Executive Hotel Vintage Court in San Francisco, CA a few years ago. Our experience with that hotel, drew us to make reservations for this one in downtown Vancouver. The only disappointment was the wine tasting, which they hold Mon - Sat. It was a small tasting of the same wine (only one) every night. And when we asked for another taste, we were told that we could only have one! The hotel in SF featured a number of different wines the atmosphere was more like a gathering. But that did not impact my impression of the hotel. I would highly recommend it and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, great service!”
Reviews.Author: DCChina
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location and walking distance to many shops, restaurants and attractions. Great view from rooms. Friendly, fantastic service from all hotel staff that we met. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Out of the city.”
Reviews.Author: MCC3303
Reviews.Content: Although out of the city - still a good walking distance to everything - shops, restaurants. Very close to water taxi to Granville Island Markets. Clean and tidy. Room had two small double beds. Appeared to accommodate business and conference people. Restaurant had a wine tasting each afternoon - only went once. A free drink of showcase wine for the day. Restaurant did not appeal. Breakfast at Joes Dinner on Davie st - fantastic value, fill you up for the day for about $8.00. Front desk staff helpful. Conceirge not overly informed. Taxi driver on trip from airport gave us a commentry on the way in - good value ride to hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it and will be back in November”
Reviews.Author: Trilogy86
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice hotel. The staff were very friendly and extremely helpful. The rooms were a little smaller, but the view was very nice and bedding was comfortable. The hotel is in a very good location, across the way from Granville Island and close to Robson and other shopping. We are going to the Grey Cup in November and have already booked this hotel. Looking forward to returning!

Reviews.Title: “Albert and Damien stole the show”
Reviews.Author: BrokerDon
Reviews.Content: Damien, at the front desk, upgraded us to a spacious room on the top floor after learning that we were staying for our anniversary weekend. Albert the concierge was very welcoming and bent over backwards to make sure we always knew where we were going, and the best way to get there. Thank you--both of you! We were there for a 3 day weekend and we noticed that the lobby was extremely busy with tour groups. Luckily we decided to check in early before the groups arrived. Albert arranged for our bags to be stored while we waited for our room to be made up. This worked out perfectly, since there were many choices for a great lunch at the waterfront, just a short walk away.

Reviews.Title: “misinformed”
Reviews.Author: NcGrandmaof3
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after reading of complimentary cruise ship terminal shuttle. Big mistake! Shuttle does not exist. yet, it is included as a feature in 2 places in ad. Hotel management offered no compensation when shown ad. This is definitely a case of false advertising. Todays ad still mentions complimentary cruise ship terminal shuttle for future booking.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & Comfortable - close to downtown”
Reviews.Author: mattyd007
Reviews.Content: We found this business hotel on a WOTIF deal so got a good price for staying so close to everything downtown. Had to pay for carpark, but I understand this is a common practice in Vancouver. Free wifi in room & very comfortable bed & immaculate bathroom. The staff were helpful & friendly and gave us a good idea of where to start walking. Just be warned - Stanley Park is NOT just a stroll along the boulevard. It is an EPIC marathon if you intend to even get halfway around. We were walking for ages (in the wrong shoes!) and were amazed to find after nearly 2 hours were barely a third of the way to the totem poles! But very scenic all the same. Tip: Amazing seafood can be found by turning left on Granville Isl and finding a great local secret - GO FISH. It was incredible and can't be missed.

Reviews.Title: “Held our AGM Using Executive Inn Vintage Park's Banquet Room”
Reviews.Author: BTEFanVancouverBC
Reviews.Content: Vancouver Gay Volleyball Association used Executive Inn Vintage Park's ballroom to host our Annual General Meeting. We had 75 guests and there was ample room for everyone. The food was quite good, the plate service was efficient and well timed, the service staff was friendly and professional. The view from the ballroom was second to none with great water views of English Bay and Granville Island. The Catering Manager Janice was a pleasure to work with. She got back to me in a timely manner when I had requests or changes. She was able to tailor a meal to fit our non profit association's budget. Downside - plastic cups used for drinks but the reasoning is that they are many stories up and have patios that are accessed from the ballroom. NIce for the views, but as usual, people that have no manners end up throwing wine glasses over the edge so we all end up with plastic. Maybe nicer plastic glasses would complement the fine dining experience that is expected... Other than that, I would totally recommend this hotel for their catering and banquet facilities....

Reviews.Title: “At least they're trying”
Reviews.Author: WanderlustyWoman
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to this hotel for a romantic anniversary trip. We booked the jacuzzi suite, judging by the photos on line it looked like the perfect room. We got to the hotel and waited for the valet to pick up our car, right by the sign that said valet... no one came out. Turn out you have to go inside the lobby as ask the concierge/bellmen/valet to get you car, if he's there. He wasn't when we checked in. When we got to our "romantic" jacuzzi suite, we discovered the photos online with a jacuzzi in the room with a view of the city, was not the jacuzzi suite.... there was a jacuzzi, in the florecent lit bathroom with rust stains, not that romantic for my taste. The room was so small the dresser covered half the desk. It was in great need of repair as well, chips in the glass top and dresser and windowsill, cracked lamp shades. We asked the front desk about the room, she said you can only get the jacuzzi in your room, if you booked directly through the hotel. So we upgraded then and there. It was a much bigger room, but still had signs of wear and tare. Part of the wall paper had been scotch taped back to the wall. Both rooms had the hardest beds I have ever slept on, we both had terrible back aches for the next two days. We ordered some champagne to be delived to our room while we were out. Two small glass bottles were sitting on our dresser, one was non-alcoholic and they were both warm... right next to an empty ice bucket.... The on site restaurant is tiny! The breakfast was comperable to a holiday Inn Express, good but nothing to wright home about. I do have to say the night concierge who went out of his way to drive us to a restaurant, after our car had been broken into earlier that day, was fabulous. He even gave us a private tour of the city. The hotel seems upscale on line, but if you stay here don't expect too much.

Reviews.Title: “Skip it”
Reviews.Author: nebularis
Reviews.Content: We had a 2 double bed room. The room was *tiny*, too much furniture in the room! The double beds were smaller than doubles, more like twin-size. Absolutely not comfortable. Very hard mattresses. Air conditioner didn't cool the room at all, even the hallways were quite warm, so we left the windows open. The decor is very dated, the hotel needs an update in the hallways and the rooms. The bathroom's massaging shower head however was very good. On check out, we asked for a taxi and waited about 30 minutes for one to arrive -- while we waited, someone went to "inspect" our room -- he came back and informed the front desk staff that we didn't "steal anything" from the room! Save yourself these headaches, pay an extra $20 and stay at the Sheraton a few blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “not that great”
Reviews.Author: tkelber
Reviews.Content: Staff were very nice, but the whole experience was a letdown after reading many positive reviews. The room was small as was the lobby. The room was posted as queen or 2 doubles, but when we arrived it was only 2 doubles. The beds were hard, like boards. They advertised a shuttle online and in their room guide - no shuttle. The hallways were a gaudy orange and very narrow, giving a cramped space-saver feeling. The neighborhood was only so-so. Went to the Holiday Inn 2-3 blocks up for a much nicer stay, room and facility - for less! Skip this one and you will be glad you did.

Reviews.Title: “A 'safe bet' if you are in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: ozvpm_andy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Executive for two nights while in Vancouver during May 2011 to break up my trip to toronto after a long leg from Australia In general, this is a good hotel. I found it to be clean, comfortable, in a good location (easy walk to downtown) and friendly staff. The hotel overall is a little dated but the rooms themselves I found to be up to date and very clean. There were only two things I could find fault with. Firstly, the airconditioning in the room was very loud when it cut in and cut out throughout the night to keep the room warm. I'm a pretty heavy sleeper, and it was enought to wake me each time it kicked in. Finally, the big drawcard for me was that this was a wine themed hotel. Being a big fan of wine (and living near the Barossa Valley) I was keen to embed myself into a hotel which advertised itself as being themed in this way. I have to say I was a bit disappointed. yes, there were ceratinly large quotes around the foyer about wine and yes there was a picture in my room of a bottle of wine, but that was about it as far as I could see. I attended one of the 'complimentary wine tasting and reception' sessions in the restaurant, because I was genuinely interested in learning more about Canadian wine and the Canadian wine industry, and expected that there would have been a small selection of wines (from the featured winery) on offer with perhaps a cellar door staff member or one of the hotels staff to explain a little more about the wines on offer. What I did experience was a number of people (mainly alone) sitting at individual tables in the small bar area drinking the half a glass of complimentary 'merlot' that was the wine of the day. The staff member asked me if I was there for the wine tasting, told me that the merlot was the wine of the day, poured me a glass and I then found my own table and drank wine on my own! I asked the young lady about the wine and other than telling me it was from a Canadian wine region not too far away, I got not much more. Don't get me wrong, I was not expecting a major wine event, but I did want to make the point for any of you serious 'winies' who may be thinking you'll stay simply for the wine theme, that it may not be as good as you think But if you are simply looking for a good, comfy, clean and safe hotel, then the Executive should fit the bill

Reviews.Title: “Dirty room”
Reviews.Author: lilyblue3
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through the BMO Vancouver Marathon "recommended hotels" page. I'm not all that hard to please when it comes to a hotel room. For a weekend like this, I don't expect anything fancy, as long as it's clean. This room was not. We got to the room and decided to relax on the bed for a bit before going out to dinner. When I got up I noticed some hair on the bed, which I assumed was mine. Then I noticed a few red/brown spots - not mine. I pulled back the sheets of the still made bed and there was much more hair and several more spots. EW! Other peoples' hair and stains? No thanks. As I was looking around the room I opened the ice bucket and it was full of water. The sink also didn't drain, but I'm sure that wasn't part of the cleaning problem. We left for dinner and told the front desk about the unclean room on our way out, they said they would have it cleaned. We came back to find a complimentary bottle of wine, which was nice. The bucket that it came in - a plastic bucket that chemicals were formerly stored in (the label was still on it) - was a bit odd. The rest of the stay was pleasant enough, although they did post a flyer for a "BMO Vancouver Marathon Breakfast" starting at 6am. I asked if it was complimentary and the front desk had to look up our reservation to see if we qualified. Turned out to be $14 each and I asked them who it was included for if not the people who had booked under the marathon promotion. She said it was for people who booked through "other websites". Odd... All in all a mediocre experience. If it was all that was left on marathon weekend there's a chance I might stay there again, but I'll look for someplace else next time I'm in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, small beds.”
Reviews.Author: ashleesiegel56
Reviews.Content: I went up to Vancouver with my cousin and boyfriend last week for a concert. This was our first time in Vancouver, and we had no idea where anything was. The staff was very helpful answering our questions and were very pleasant. Especially the guy at the front desk, Gus. He was extremely helpful and nice! The only thing that I did not like about this room were the beds. The double bed rooms aren't queen size beds. They are full and it is kind of hard to sleep on with two people. Other then that, everything was great!

Reviews.Title: “Best Location Great Room Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: TJLambert
Reviews.Content: I have been a guest in about a dozen hotels in the Vancouver city area over the past twenty years, and I like the Vintage Park the best and will be my preferred hotel from now on. My husband and I stayed three nights in a cozy room with a magnificent view of the city. The staff was attentive and well-mannered. It was a quick walk to the water taxi to Granville Island for lunch and another quick walk to Robeson Street for shopping and lunch. We had a quick walk to a Zipcar for a trip to the UBC campus for a concert. On our last night we stayed in an ordered very good room service dinner and a pay-per-view movie snuggled in bed. The room was clean, the bed comfortable and the shower was hot and had strong water pressure. The drawbacks were the daily wine tasting, a real attraction for us, only had a bartender working the entire restaurant pouring what amounted to a complimentary glass of wine & a bowl of snacks. Someone needs to be there to talk wine! Other drawback is that we could not get internet to work anywhere in the hotel. The in-room cable hookup to my husband's laptop was not able to connect and I took my iPad all over the hotel common areas where there was supposed to be wi-fi to no avail. We decided to take a vacation from being wired in. However, we had planned to use the internet to navigate the city and find places, so we did less and relaxed more. However, if we had needed the internet for work or communication, we would have made a fuss. I am reasonably sure that the hotel staff would have done their best to help us resolve whatever issue we encountered.

Reviews.Title: “The beds were very hard”
Reviews.Author: onthego06_30
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed out stay at the Executive; clean, good service, good value as it came with a very nice breakfast buffet and a good location (within walking distance to Robson and Granville). However, I would not be able to stay there again only because we found the bed to be extremely hard.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay there again”
Reviews.Author: LGow
Reviews.Content: Overall, the hotel is ok, but there is a lot missing in the details. Some of the staff were friendly and helpful, others not so much. I wound up having to change rooms because in the first room I was given the ventilation fan squeaked and rattled so loudly I wouldn't have been able to sleep. When speaking with the front desk, they told me they were sending someone up to assist me. The concierge then called me from the elevator and asked me to meet him there "if I didn't have too much stuff". He offered no assistance, as I carried two bags, my purse, coat and a few other items and instead held out a key for me to take in my already over full hands. Upon arriving at the new room he informed me "all our ventilation fans make noise you know" (as if to say it was my fault for being overly sensitive to it). The new room was somewhat quieter, but still quite loud. The room was reasonably clean, although rather small, I couldn't open the dresser drawer fully or stand in front of the dresser because it was behind a table. The lighting was also very poor, even with all the curtains open for the daylight and all the lights on, I still felt like I was in a cave. The food quality in the restaurant was mediocre at best, and way over priced for what it was. The service was reasonably good, though when I attempted to go for breakfast one morning the restaurant didn't open until 10 minutes past the posted opening time. I found myself a little annoyed on the second morning of my stay when I opened the room door, expecting to pick up my newspaper and found that there wasn't one. I also was left wondering about the "wine themed room" there wasn't really a theme, unless you count a dingy picture of a wine bottle on the wall, and the over priced bottle of Jackson Triggs in the minibar. I wouldn't choose to spend my money there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable with a few quirks”
Reviews.Author: dianmerr
Reviews.Content: My room was quite comfortable, but I found some things inconvenient. For example, the ice machine was on one floor (not mine) and the soda machine on another (also not mine). The heating system was quite noisy and the room was somewhat drafty. It was well kept and very clean however. To use the hotel computer to get my boarding pass cost $3, and then it really did not work very well and I had to get assistance to complete my checkin. The staff was very friendly and helpful in all instances and the restaurant was very good, but pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Great venue, approachable and accomodating staff.”
Reviews.Author: SavvyMedia
Reviews.Content: I just wanted to say how impressed we were with the overall support we received from the staff and in terms of working through the glitches for our event. They, and you, were all so approachable and accommodating...and always with a smile (all the way from Albert at the front door, Alphonse in catering, to the people at the front desk)! It was no easy endeavour having all those events in one day but it all worked out and everyone was thrilled with the results. The food was also amazing and everyone’s needs were not only met, but in most cases exceeded beyond their expectations. It was also nice to have the GM Jared checking in personally to make sure everything was working out. I also understand that everyone who stayed at the hotel were also quite pleased with their accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service”
Reviews.Author: M0lly54
Reviews.Content: Excellent service by well trained and pleasant staff. The food was wonderful, the price was great and the rooms were very comfortablet.Great value and I would not stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel with excellent hotel staff”
Reviews.Author: davidgmg
Reviews.Content: I stay here frequently both with groups and for personal trips while in Vancouver. While I have encountered good service from many hotels the Executive has an exceptionally attentive group of employees. After one stay everyone seems to remember who you are and I've never had a more outstanding staff of workers from the waiters, concierge to front desk help. Yes the rooms are smaller than some hotels but just ask for a room with two beds. I've never heard noise from the road. This hotel at least the windows open for ventilation. I like the parking which is reasonable by Vanc standard at $15 per nite. The location close to Granville Market is very nice. The fact that the hotel will shuttle you to the heart of downtown or the cruise ship terminal is just one more great feature. I've stayed here 15 times the past few yrs and have never been dissapointed once. Its a great 'hidden treasure' and I highly recommend them.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, excellent food, great wine tasting--a pleasure to stay there”
Reviews.Author: Darlene123456
Reviews.Content: Excellent location and accomodating staff made the business trip a pleasure. I am a return customer and would highly recommend the hotel. They worked exceptionally hard to accommodate our group and our needs. Walking distance to many Vancouver sites. They even had umbrellas!

Reviews.Title: “best value in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: 154937Doberman
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in this hotel for many years. The location is ideal--close to everything and within walking distance. The staff are most helpful and welcoming. Always have good recommendations of where to eat. and things to do. We love this hotel !

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience Time and Time AGAIN....”
Reviews.Author: Babs1212
Reviews.Content: I travel with work alot and the overall experience with Executive Hotel Vintage Park is 2nd to none...as soon as you walk in the door you are met with smiling faces and great attitudes from all the employees from the front desk to the restaurant... The rooms are always very clean and the beds are great to sleep on... I look forward to my trips to Vancouver to be looked after by the hotel as if I was at home... Thanks....Bruce Babiuk

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms”
Reviews.Author: next_mover
Reviews.Content: If this hotel were in America, it would be positioned somewhere between a Marriott Courtyard and a lower-end Hampton Inn. The rooms are small! Not bad for one person, definitely too tight for two. The closet and bathrooms are also small. I got up in the dark to go to the bathroom in the middle of the and got it confused with the closet. Everything is pretty pushed together. Good things: nice front desk agent, relatively affordable parking (watch the tax however, it's about 30 % of the base fee), convenient location at south end of downtown, parking is accessible from main elevator, nice hot tub outside on deck in middle of building, oblique views of English bay, stylish room furnishings, nicely working window coverings; easy walking distance to the waterfront, a quick drive across the bridge to Granville Island and Kits. Not so great: rooms are small and oddly configured. hallways are low ceilinged, confusing, wallpapered without much style. They hit you for the little things: $!0 for internet, $1 for 800 access on the phone, no free internet in the lobby. Good location but definitely not prime, since the access is on a sidestreet below a bridge ramp. Avoid getting rooms on the south or southeast side or you'll be looking at headlights driving below all night; bed lamp shades that are opaque and bulbs that are weak, making it hard to read in bed; not enough room to read anywhere but on the bed. We were deciding between this and the Listel. We'll probably do the Listel next time. The parking is more expensive there, and its definitely a busier location on Robson, but overall that just seems like a more open and inviting hotel, and the rooms are definitely larger and more inviting.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Service, but Good location”
Reviews.Author: melinmelb_8
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 3 nights back in September. The location is good, close to Granville market, walking distance to train station, and shopping area on Robson St. The receptionist wasn't really friendly, as we requested and specified that we need 2 beds (as my friend and I are not couple), and when we arrived they insisted that we can only have 1 king bed room, after giving us hard time for 30 minutes, then he gave us room with 2 beds. The breakfast is too expensive for the quality and choices of the food, about $17.00 p/p with not much choices. you can find a lot of good breakfast places nearby the hotel. Rooms is big and clean. but the next time we visit Vancouver, I will not come back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Stay”
Reviews.Author: SavageFrontier
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 6 nights for a combination business meeting and vacation. I found all of the staff to be friendly and helpful. The room met my expectations. Comfortable bed, good towels, good water pressure in the shower, and new TV. The 5 p.m. wine sampling featured a wonderful local wine each time. The restaurant had good breakfasts and dinners. The location is very close to live music at the Yale, the G Sportsbar on Granville, and the Aquabus ferry to Granville Island. Bus, Skytrain, and taxi connections are very accessible. There are many buses on Granville Street and on Davie Street to take you to the rest of downtown. My investment group used three rooms, and all of us were satisfied. The security at the hotel is excellent. My only complaint is that the jacuzzi and outdoor patio closes at 10:30 p.m., too early for us on some of the nights we stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Won't go there again”
Reviews.Author: protegee1
Reviews.Content: We were given a room that was extremely small and very noisy. Our first room was situated right next to the ramp for Granville bridge. After a sleepless night, we asked to be moved or refunded for the balance of our stay. We were going to go elsewhere. We were upgraded to a king size room with a king size bed. It was much better. It was a regular size room, nothing spacious. On our last morning, we did not have any hot water at 6 am! When we return to Vancouver, we will definitely book elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: MooeyWirral
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on 2 separate occasions- one at the beginning of our holiday for 4 nights, and then at the end again for 1 night. For the 2 weeks we had in BC, this hotel was the cheapest, having found it online for £50 per night room only. Pretty good for City Centre. There's not a lot to get excited about at this hotel, as it is the usual city centre drab/ boring hotel, but on the plus side it is quite well situated and the rooms are modern, clean and (some) are roomy. On the first leg of our trip we stayed in a Queen room. The room was compact to say the least, but had everything we needed and a comfy bed. There was also a huge spa bath with a shower over it which was lovely. One the second leg however we were put in a room with 2 double beds which was much bigger, smaller bathroom, but the beds were tiny! Neither of us is large by any stretch of the imagination, but we struggled to fit in together! The two rubbish things for me at this hotel were a) the TV system which wasn't normal channels but some weird computerised system that was not easy to use at all. It was as if they wanted to make it difficult so that you would just give up and pay for a movie and b)The wine tasting was a bit of a joke. Not really wine tasting but just a spash of wine in your glass to 'taste' and that was it- just one wine. However, now I have seen how expensive wine is in BC so I can understand that at £50 a room they can't really be expected to host a lavish wine tasting every night! I can't believe that advertise it as such as it seems to upset people more than not offering anything at all! The hotel was extremely good value but I would only stay here again if I got the same deal (because it was cheap) not because it was 'stand out' in any way.

Reviews.Title: “Stay elsewhere if you can”
Reviews.Author: MartinAdrogué
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights here with my family in order to explore Vancouver. I had booked two rooms, one with a king bed and one with two double beds. However, when I checked in they said they had no rooms with two beds. After talking for a while they gave us a room with two beds, but the girls at the front desk were not friendly at all. Not what you´d expect from a 3 1/2-star hotel. The whole property seems quite new but at the same time run down. Carpets are old and the rooms are not very clean -dust on most furniture. The rooms and bathrooms are quite small, though the decoration and views were nice. Decent beds and no complimentary wi fi. There´s an underground parking for 15 usd per day, which doesn´t seem expensive for Vancouver. The location is not bad, 15 min walk from some nice commercial areas. However, the neighborhood close to the hotel is not very nice -sex shops, ugly stores, weird people caused a bad first impression of this great city. I´m definitely going back to Vancouver some day -and I´m definitely choosing another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: chi77subra
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a short walk away from most bus lines and the aqua bus to Granville.A longer walk to the sky train.The rooms are clean and well maintained. Some of the rooms esp the corner ones are definitely much smaller. As is usual with the fancier hotels, there is no breakfast included, no free internet, no appliances except a fridge for their chocolates and things. There is a coffee maker in the room and I have say, the coffee was excellent.Cordial service,room service was average- there was no soap in the room for 2 nights.Overall, a bit overrated.

Reviews.Title: “location”
Reviews.Author: docket
Reviews.Content: Stayed 6 Days in Vancouver,the hotel is a good location in dowmtown area, public transport on your door,rooms very clean free newspaper to your room every morning, staff very helpful got a good deal from hotwire

Reviews.Title: “small sized but very nice otherwise”
Reviews.Author: PTMike
Reviews.Content: Don't let the small lobby and rooms shy you away from this nice hotel. The rooms, though small, are tastefully decorated and have everything you'd need....including a jacuzzi tub for two in the bathroom. There's also a "rooftop" outdoor hot tub that is nice. Great restaurants, the waterfront, and museums are within walking distance. All around, a pretty darn good deal with only $15/night secure parking. We'd happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I got the star treatment from the friendliest hotel team I have ever met”
Reviews.Author: Kini68
Reviews.Content: I can’t say enough about how fantastic this hotel is!! It’s number one asset is the staff. Not just a couple of people, but every single person I met from the GM to the cleaner was friendly, helpful and couldn’t do enough for me. In particular Allen, Gus, Ashley and Jennifer were fantastic. They gave me suggestions about their favourite things to see and do in the city etc. And they upgraded me from my hotel room to a luxury apartment on the 18th (top) floor– so I had two bedrooms, two bathrooms, massive open plan lounge/kitchen/dining, laundry (bonus!), walk in wardrobes, spa bath and stunning vistas all the way around overlooking False Creek, Granville Island etc. I was dancing around in the great bit space wishing I had someone to enjoy it with! The food in the restaurant La Vallee was EXCELLENT. They had a 3 course special which was just divine. And they have other specials each day such as Martini Thursday. Only downside was that there are no pay-for-view movies in the apartments. For me as a solo traveller, I like the option of watching films at night. But there were 50+ channels of cable television and DVD players. The wine receptions also need to be re-named. It was more of a wine ‘sampling’ – with one wine tasted each evening between 5-6pm. But it was a good idea and a great place to meet people and talk. I got the feeling most people were expecting more wines to taste and/or something to snack on (because of the name of it). But these little things didn't spoil it for me at all - as the service was so excellent. The second best thing the hotel has going for it is the location. I just thought it was the best place to stay in the city. It was only a two block walk downhill to the aqua bus over to Granville Island (a place I loved so much that I went there 3 times). You had the blue route trolley bus pickup right next door at the Quality Inn and the red route pickup just around the corner at the Cascadia Hotel. Walk a couple of blocks up and right on Davie and you were in Yaletown for all the restaurants, or a couple of blocks up and left on Davie and you were in the Davie Village shops (internet shop, supermarket, bottle store etc). Then just straight up 6 blocks or so to the heart of the city and the Skytrain, Canada line train, Pacific Centre shopping, Art Gallery etc. Nice scenic walks both ways from bottom of hill around to Yaletown/False Creek or along English Bay to Stanley Park. I would absolutely stay there again and highly recommend this to other travellers who like to walk a city and like to be away from the big brand hotels and cruise ship passengers (on the other side of town).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: maukd
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great located, one block from the sigthseeing tour stop and public transportation. It is located on an important street but near the bridge ramp so you don't have cars or trucks near your window. If you need to take a taxi to the cruise ship terminal it is only 10 dollars and less than 5 minutes. They have a great pet policy, you can bring your dog and they provide everything to protect the furniture so the dog could be in the room. One of the staff member called GUS is very helpful, ready to adivse about places to go, or help you with any of your needs about the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stay far, far away. They charge you for everything.”
Reviews.Author: tess1414
Reviews.Content: Friends recommended this hotel and what a huge disappointment! This hotel is so cheap with everything, it's really a no frills, one star hotel. Upon arrival, we noticed how tiny the rooms were, but online they present these rooms larger than they really are. In the bathroom, the hotel couldn't afford new rolls of toilet paper, so they left us less than half a roll. We called housekeeping for a roll of toilet paper, we left a polite message, and no one returned our call. Needless to say, we went out to purchase toilet paper. Don't ask for an extra towel, you have to wait until the next day. They charge for everything...including LOCAL calls and the internet. We just wanted to get our flight confirmation online (for the flight home) but we were to be charged for that. The rooms are not cleaned properly. It's best if you go out and purchase your own coffee instead of using their filthy coffemaker. They leave one sugar, one single,(wrinkled) pack of coffemate, and that's it. If you need to write a message, they have no pen, and no writing pad. We were not told about the wine receptions they have, we were not informed about their restaurant, their breakfasts, and actually, the only few words said to us upon arrival was to hand them our credit card. We did not receive a newspaper. We were not told of any of their amenities This hotel must have anointed itself as a 4 star hotel, which is laughable. It's a shame that we didn't read the feedback from other hotel sites, to see that others were not treated well and also encountered problems. Not a friendly employee to be found...except the polite, men who work at the concierge desk. We have informed all our friends and families to stay far, far away from this place.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Aussie4701
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for two nights from 22nd to 24th May after making the booking directly with the hotel via internet from Australia a few weeks prior. The desk attendants were quite friendly and the hotel is in a good location. The room was very small but clean. I agree with another reviewer that the charge for internet use was very expensive. We ate at the restaurant one night and was very impressed with the quality of the meal.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Yorky201024
