Reviews.Content: We started our 4 week visit from the UK to British Columbia & Alberta at this hotel. We found it expensive in general, Plus $9.99 a day for internet access was way over the top considering most hotels on the trip gave it free. We had to ask several times to get our room cleaned, and items appeared on our bill that we had not ordered, and the receptionist did not really care about sorting it out.....eventually the bill was corrected. The worse thing was the alleged "Wine Tasting" this we were told takes place every afternoon. It consisted of several already open, small bottles of cheap merlot , first poured into a glass caraffe, then into our glasses.......That was it......not what a European would class as a wine tasting. There was a Hot Tub but never any clean towels!

Reviews.Title: “Albert the concierge is the reason the hotel is great”
Reviews.Author: suzyEdmonton
Reviews.Content: We stayed here June 2 - 6. Rooms are small, but clean. The apartment units are very nice. The wine tasting each evening is a nice touch and is a great way to meet some interesting people. The location is very good. Walking distance to some area attractions and shopping. They also have a free shuttle to the cruise port. All the staff are friendly and helpful. We do recommend you say hi to Albert, the concierge. He makes this hotel stand out from the others. We will return to the Executive Vintage Park just to see Albert again.

Reviews.Title: “Better hotels than this one.”
Reviews.Author: Secwepemc
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel at the recommendation of a friend. We usually stay elsewhere when we are in Vancouver and will probobly go back to the other place we liked. The location of this hotel is wierd. To find it easily if you are not familiar with Vancouver is a bit of a challenge. It is very small and cramped. The restaurant menu was expensive so we didnt go there. The place is like fort knox which was thankful as we seen more than a few scary looking people wandering around. Staff was friendly and helpful. Room was not that clean, the light switches had dirty fingerprints on them and the whirlpool tub had pinkish type of buildup around the jets. View was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Might charge you after you leave!”
Reviews.Author: AcademicTripper
Reviews.Content: Our kind mother booked this hotel with her points, and we suspect that paying with points put us low on the priority list. They tried to put us in a single room (two adults and a toddler!) and would not give us a cot for our child, since they said the room was too small. No kidding. We found out from our mother that she had booked a double room - they had no record of this but did, same day, switch us to a bigger room. The security was good at this hotel and the front desk was friendly. This was good. We got a rude awakening when we got home, however. We found a charge for about $40 on our credit card statement, well after we had left. We called and they claimed that a both robe went missing. AKA accusing us of theft. But why wouldn't they contact us about this? They simply charged our card. No signature, no notice. I recalled our robes going from two to one after a room cleaning, but I didn't think anything of it and did not mention it when we were there. Anyway, they did reverse the charge, thank you. Overall, it was insulting. We won't go again.

Reviews.Title: “The concierge at this hotel made our trip wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: 2traveling_together
Reviews.Content: The room was somewhat small, but clean, quiet, comfortable, and reasonably priced. The hotel is within walking distance of many city attractions. This was a great choice of locations to stay in Vancouver, but all the more so due to their concierge, Albert. Upon arrival we were immediately greeted by Albert with a fantastic, warm smile. He showed us to our room, described every amenity the hotel offered, and then at our request, gave up top notch recommendation on where to go and what to see during our short stay so we could get the most out of our visit. The personal attention was beyond anything we have experienced in typical hotel stays but then it got even better. On our first night we bought postcards to send to family but we arrived late and hadn't had a chance to mail them. Albert offered to drive us to the main post office (at 10:00 PM!!) because he said they process mail all night for morning dispatch and this would help get our cards delivered to family before we got back. Few concierges would do this for something so small as a few postcards, but Albert made the hospitality of Vancouver shine with his extra effort and helped make our wedding anniversary even more special.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel midtown Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: TampaFLtraveller
Reviews.Content: My husband and I enjoyed our visit to Vancouver very much because of the great rate, central location and hospitality (evening wine tasting, yummy breakfast in cozy restaurant) of this hotel. Room was small but comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Service!”
Reviews.Author: Avarelli
Reviews.Content: We booked this Hotel for 3 nights while staying in Downtown Vancouver for my birthday. Location wise: It is located right by the ferry to get to Granville Island which turned out to be very convenient. We would walk 2 blocks down to catcht he ferry, check out the market and brewery on Granville Island, then take the ferry on to Yaletown for dinner, and then walk back to our hotel (15 min). It is also a 5minute walk to the where all of the clubs and lounges are. A little far to walk to Robson and Stanley Park, but a very short cab ride. Overall, not a bad location. Hotel: When we first checked in, we were greeted very warmly by the concierge. They checked us into a tiny tiny room at first, but we called down and checked to see if there was a bigger room available and the woman at the front desk was very sweet and switched us to a larger room (the Orsini, it's called) with no extra charge and no fuss. The hotel has a small hot tub that never got busy, so it was like having your own hot tub and a gym that had everything you need for a quick workout. I would definitely recommend this hotel for someone who is on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Ok stay, good enough but a bit overpriced.”
Reviews.Author: loubob07
Reviews.Content: This hotel is quite new inside - with the bar/restaurant having been recently refurbished, but the hotel rooms felt a little worn, but they were perfectly adequate for a short city break. The hotel is close to the waterfront (a few minutes walk) and they offer a free shuttle into the city centre. We enjoyed the free wine tastings in the evening, and the waitress was very friendly & helpful with local suggestions of where to go. Negatives however, was that the price was a little steep, and upon check out our agreed price had increased, but we had a train to catch so were in no position to stand around to argue/prove our previously agreed price. The rooms were a little small, and clean enough, but ours looked out onto a busy highway & some noise was heard. Also, internet access was expensive. Overall, not brilliant, but ok for a short stay, especially if you are lucky to find a bargain rate somewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy place with lot's of not kept promices”
Reviews.Author: Piehkana
Reviews.Content: Room on the level of the busiest highway in Vancouver with poor window sealing. Impossible to sleep without ear plugs. Even with plugs the noise came through.

Reviews.Title: “It worked for us”
Reviews.Author: fsba20
Reviews.Content: Booked this the day before on Hotwire and got a good deal. We moved from the Hyatt who could not offer us an additional night at the Hotwire price we had originally booked with. Girl at reception was friendly, our room was ready early so we could move straight in. The room was a little small but clean. The view was not brilliant but this was not an issue for us. I would stay agian but if going to be for a few nights might pay more for a one bedroom apartment, Location was fine, easy walk from the centre.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Accommodation Good Service”
Reviews.Author: coopy09
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel 3 times during our recent trip to Vancouver. Each time we had a very pleasant stay the rooms were of a great standard ,very clean ,comfortable beds and within walking distance to the city centre. The service from the hotel staff was very good, they were pleasant and helpful. The complimentry bus downtown is a good service especially to the cruise terminal. Very close to good dining and to the bus stop for the hop on - Hop off sightseeing tour bus. Right outside door of hotel. There is a group of small restaurants for breakfast and a laundromat just behind the hotel on the main street.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Good Location and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: jansak
Reviews.Content: I was going to write a review when I arrived home but after seeing the last review I had to write now. I am wondering where that person stayed. I did not see a cockroach or fly. The rooms were spotless and there was no odour in the hallway. I think the price was unbelievable when you compare it to other hotels in Vancouver. A 1 star which I will not name which is also a great hotel was double the price. The location of the Executive is wonderul. You can walk to aquabus to Granville Island, downtown, English Bay etc. I would never hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone, and I am fussy. The consierge Albert was so helpful. He guided us on where to eat, how to get there and made our stay so enjoyable by always greeting us with a friendly smile and a quick chat. He is an asset to this hotel. The rest of the staff were also very helpful. I would stay there just to experience Albert's great personality and love of his job. The rooms are small but who spends a lot of time in their room.The dining room is a hidden gem. We had the fixe price menu and was excellent value and wonderful foodl. We had a wonderful trip to BC and staying at this hotel was one of the highlites. We definitely will return.

Reviews.Title: “Hoped for better, but reasonable for $89 on Hotwire.”
Reviews.Author: eurojamie04
Reviews.Content: The location was great. Really close to Granville Island and walkable to everything, including the north shore Seabus. Bed was very comfortable, sheets and towels were nice. Room was small, though clean, full of light, fresh air, cozy and OK. Service was OK. Nothing special. Hallways smelled like body odor. Helpful concierge. It looks nothing like it does on the Web site, and their complementary wine tastings and claim to be a destination by wine lovers is a joke. Jacuzzi was disgusting. Flies and cockroaches all around.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, staff and service”
Reviews.Author: can80an
Reviews.Content: I was a bit hesitant to book this hotel based on reviews from Expedia and Tripadivsor. But for the very low $ in mid-May, it was a bargain. Considering other hotels just 1-2 blocks more in to downtown was already in the $100+ range. From the moment I stepped into the lobby around 8pm Sunday, it was great service. The doorman opened the door, even though all I had was my hiking bag, and I saw him walk from the front desk to get the doors when he saw me arriving. He was all smiles, as was the Front Deskman, Oliver. He was very helpful in giving me tourist info and local eating/area info. I room was really clean, it had a new look and modern decor compared to a 4 Star hotel I stay at in Toronto (my work pays for that, in case you were wondering why I'd stay at Executive if I've been in a 4). At this hotel, the bed and pillows were much firmier. The towels are much whiter. Although the distance of the hotel is about a leisure 20 min walk to downtown, the hotel more than made up for it. I had already figured that what I saved in hotel $, I could use for public transportation if it was really far from points of interest but it wasn't. The nice reception didn't stop there. The next day was all rain. I stopped at the Front Desk to ask a question, which Hosay was pretty nice to pull up some bus maps and schedules. There was a lady, management maybe, cause she wasn't in hotel uniform, she offered to lend me the hotel umbrella. I would definitely recommend this hotel, and hope they have as great of an experience as I did. Tip about getting to the hotel: The Airport Shuttle's (go to Vancouver Airport website for link/$) first stop is Cascadia Hotel, a 3 block walk. I chose to get dropped off at the last stop Best Western on Drake, a one block walk. If you're in no hurry, staying on the shuttle for the whole route gives you a tour of the city, and an idea of how far everything is. It was only a half hour shuttle ride to do the route. An hour total from airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great overnight experience”
Reviews.Author: luvinlifeLangley_BC
Reviews.Content: We arrived downtown around 5:30 pm on a Saturday to look for a place to stay since we had tickets for a show at the Commodore later that evening. After stopping at a couple other hotels closer to downtown core and found some rates high and other hotels had poor or no parking we ventured a couple blocks further and spotted the Executive Hotel. The front desk clerk was helpful with a smooth check in since we had no reservation. We negotiated a fair rate with secure parking included. The building was secure as you need your room card to get to any floor with a room. The room was a bit small but was quite adequate, it was clean, had a remodeled bathroom, room safe and had a great view. Since we were running short on time we decided to try the hotel restaurant La Vallee. We had the $35 dinner special that included choice of appetizer, entree, and dessert. It was an exceptional gourmet meal not to be missed! On our way back to our room we discovered the hot tub that overlooked the city............next visit we will enjoy that. The front desk was prompt in getting us a cab to the Commodore.........only a $7 fare.........after the show it was only a short walk back maybe 10 minutes. The linens were new and good quality. The bed was firm,plenty of pillows, had a good nights sleep. We will definately stay here again but arrive earlier to take advantage of the complimentary wine tasting late afternoons.

Reviews.Title: “Small & Dirty Rooms, Nice Views, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: goingoutoftown
Reviews.Content: We stayed here under a recommendation for a wedding. The room was small and not the cleanest. Mirrors and bathroom were dirty. Though the room was small it did make it cozy, I wouldn't suggest it for anyone travelling with a whole family a couple would be good. The nicest thing I would say is that it was a great location to where we needed to be and seemed close to get anywhere and again views were pretty. I would not say this is by any means an "executive" hotel though, it definitaly wasn't woth the price I paid and I got a wedding discount. If I were an executive it wouldn't be my forst choice. The staff was really friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: DixieNetherlands
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel via Expedia. After reading the reviews we were a bit anxious but we were pleasantly surprised. Our room on the 6th floor was modern, had good beds, was very clean. It is not a huge room there is room for one suitcase in the closet. The airconditioning does make noise but we turned it off during the night. If you are not afraid to walk it is perfectly situated. You can easily walk to Canada Place and Granville Island is around the corner. The gym has nice equipment and the view is outstanding! The staff was friendly and helpfull. We would defintely book this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Okay - though not for the price”
Reviews.Author: SED77
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on our first night after flying into Vancouver from London. The hotel itself is very nice, but for the price we paid, not to mention the price for parking, it wasn’t that great. Apparently, we had been upgraded - though our room was very small. No breakfast was included either and it was a fair old way to the main shops and Robson Street. We’d booked it for our return from travelling around, but cancelled it and stayed at the Metropolitan instead, which was fantastic! Cheaper via a booking agency online and five mins walk to the main shops and close to the other attractions too. This is a nice hotel, however, I felt it very pricey for what we got and its location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Enough”
Reviews.Author: h2osmiles
Reviews.Content: Nice enough hotel - enjoyed the free wine tastings and the proximity to public transit that can get you just about anywhere. However, I would caution couples against booking a "double" room. It has two double beds, which seem a lot smaller than what might be considered a double in the US. Thankfully, my significant other and I enjoy sleeping close, but for those sleepers who like more space opt for the room with the king size bed. A big plus was the GIANT jacuzzi tub, it was wonderful to sit and relax in after a long day of sight seeing! Overall, we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Choose another hotel”
Reviews.Author: Coopda
Reviews.Content: My personal experience with this hotel was not a pleasant one overall. Check-in was very slow, and the staff seemed ill equipped or unwilling to deal with problems. Tthe noise from the Granville Bridge just outside was hard to ignore as was the demolition of a building across the street. The location is central, but a little out of the way. It was the first night of our trip and the toilet in the bathroom filled up and began to overflow. We went downstairs and told the lady at the front desk, who didn't seem to take it at all seriously. After some persuasion the security guard came up to our room to see if he could stop the flooding, which by now was flooding the carpet, and through the roof of the floor below. Because there were no other rooms available the lady suggested we remain in the room...which really wasn't an option At around 1:30pm that night, after traveling for over 24 hours from Australia, we were finally offered a room in the Hotel next door. To their credit, when we returned the next night we were upgraded and offered a voucher for a free breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Ok stay”
Reviews.Author: lwu22qq
Reviews.Content: Hotel was ok. Good location, friendly staff, good elevators. Internet access is wired only, was very expensive and was slow. Parking is $12'day. Room was nice and comfortable, Short walk to entertainment and shops.

Reviews.Title: “Wine Inspired...Hmmm??”
Reviews.Author: midnightsailor27
Reviews.Content: After staying here it is humorous to read the website about a "Wine" Inspired hotel.. Someone must have been drinking alot of cheap wine when they designed this number! We stayed at the Executive for two nights and had the same problems everyone else is having issues with and wouldn't recommend. Issues are: A) The HVAC system is old and antiquated for the property making rooms smell like smoke not to mention any clothes you have in your suitcase B) The furnishings are tired. The hotel needs to invest some money back into the bedding, fixtures, and carpets and decor. C) Small rooms that again need more attention. The positives are that you're walking distance to the ferry over to Granville and the beaches. Vancouver in general is very walkable you just have to be street savy and and I wouldn't advise any night jaunts by yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't recommend this one!”
Reviews.Author: Luvtotravel20
Reviews.Content: Definitely would not recommend this hotel. The A/C was not working in our room and the only suggestion from staff was to leave the windows open. No air circulation and sounds of city traffic all night long. Needless to say we didn't get any rest. The 2nd night we were moved to another room and the only reason we stayed was because we couldn't find a room anywhere else. The beds were terrible, not comfortable at all. While this hotel was rated 3.5, we didn't feel it came close to a 2. Staff was friendly enough, but I had hoped they would have offered some consolation for the heat discomfort. We travel a lot and have never written a review before - that's how bad it was!

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs”
Reviews.Author: MTZSeattle
Reviews.Content: Not a bad deal @ $185 per night, close to Granville Island and a short walk to English Bay. Wouldnt stay again though. Flea bites!! ( they allow pets) , broken coffee pot which they replaced, bad restaurant, but pleasant staff. I'll stay at the Best Western across the street next time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: jimbob22
Reviews.Content: Superb hotel, great staff, so friendly and helpful (especially Ivanca and Albert) best hotel in Vancouver. Great rooms quiet, very close to Granville island too. We extended our stay it was so good.

Reviews.Title: “OK -but hotel could easily be better”
Reviews.Author: Roadtrip1066
Reviews.Content: Made reservation on their website for 2 rooms but on arival they could only fine one despite me having 2 reservation reference numbers! A bit of I.T. work required! Rooms are small but clean. There was a problem with the air ventalation on our floor which circulated tobacco smoke into non smoking rooms and the corridor.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget choice”
Reviews.Author: travel_stuff2009
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 nights as this hotel (June 10-14) and found it to be sufficient for my purpose and fair value for what I paid ($112/night from Hotwire). ROOM: The room was really small but clean. The bed is the most comfortable I have slept on and I would stay at this hotel again just for that alone. Although very small (reminded me of Parisian hotel rooms), the room had everything I needed. However, I would suggest that the hotel update their furniture and information desk-packets as the furniture was nicked up and the info package had stains and typos. With regards to noise as addressed by previous reviewers, I was on the 9th floor and did not hear any noise of the highway ramp outside. LOCATION: The location was fine – I have no complaints in that regard. It was a five minute walk to catch the water taxi to Granville Island and the hop-on/hop-off trolley car stops in front of the hotel next door. Also I took local transit to the Airport and the bus stop was only 2 blocks away on the same side of the street and cost me $2.50 to get to the airport. I walked across town from the hotel to Canada Place (the opposite side of town) and it took me a comfortable 20-25 minutes - so for people who like to explore on foot the location of this hotel should not be a problem. There are also a couple of convenience stores around the corner. RESTAURANT: I managed to eat at the restaurant one night as I was too tired to venture out again and was pleasantly surprised. The service was excellent and the food was good and fairly priced. Overall, I would stay at this hotel next time I visit Vancouver but only if I received the same price or very similar. For anything more than what I paid this hotel is not worth it. I think it’s a great budget hotel and for people who just want a safe and clean hotel to get a good night sleep it fits the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location But..”
Reviews.Author: Touring56
Reviews.Content: Hotel is well located and easy to walk to bus or harbor ferry. One problem I had was the room was small although well equipped and I reserved a non-smoking room and was given a smoking room. This was very disappointing as I found it almost overpowering every time I re-entered the room. There also seemed to be some confusion in locating my reservation as well which may have been to problem.

Reviews.Title: “Good overall....but eat out!”
Reviews.Author: MsFi
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel convenient and comfortable and the staff were friendly and helpful. The room was small but well equipped. However I was disappointed with the restaurant. The hotel touts itself as a fine dining experience but I ate 2 meals there and found them less than satisfactory. However there are plenty of other eating places locally. It is convenient that the hotel is on the tour bus stop route :)

Reviews.Title: “Overall Good”
Reviews.Author: HD1989
Reviews.Content: Stay was good overall. The location is good for getting to the waterfront and Granville Island, about 3 blocks. The hotel was nice, bed very comfortable, flat panel TV, etc. Make sure to try and get a room that does not face the interstate ramps. I could hear interstate traffic and was also right by the elevator, so more noise. I also had inquired about the advertised free downtown shuttle in advance of my arrival and was given information that it ran all day on availability. Found out when I arrived, that it only ran 3 times per day. I considered the hotel restaurant for breakfast, but it was really expensive. There is another cheaper option just a few blocks away (White Spot). The only saving grace to my stay, the bellman was very helpful and spent a lot of time answering my questions and giving suggestions.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad place to stay”
Reviews.Author: threefats
Reviews.Content: Got this hotel on hotwire.com. For the price (~90/night American) was not a bad experience. The hotel was slightly outside of downtown but I did not mind it at all as it was close to the ferries for granville island. The room was slightly small but clean; the bed was comfortable as well.

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: oneboxfish
Reviews.Content: It's not a westin, but for the price it is a good value. Albert, the concierage was the best i have ever encountered. He provided accurate insights to local restaurants that turned to be quite fabulous. He even drove us to one. During my stay, i stayed in two rooms. The showers are not pressure controlled, so you can get burned very easily and suddenly. The shower curtains are so close to the shower heads, they cling to you during the shower. The black out blinds are just a few inches too short. The TV has no menu so you never know what's on. Some of the help is really quite good and some are not so helpful. The location is very good, walking distances to good restaurants, and granville island.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good value”
Reviews.Author: icelara
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Executive Hotel Vintage Park for 3 nights. Overall, it was a pleasant experience. The hotel is undergoing some renovation in the front lobby, but we weren't bothered by noise by it. We arrived and checked into our room. Once we got inside, we knew that our room was a smoking room by the smell, so we immediately went downstairs and asked for a new room. The front desk immediately switched our room for a non-smoking room. The size of the room itself is quite small, but we were outside for most of the day so it was fine. The whirlpool tub is very nice and large. Vancouver isn't too large of a city to get around, so we found this hotel to be in an area easy to navigate and walked to Yaletown and Robson Street with no problems. Overall it was a nice stay. I'm only sorry that we never got back to the hotel in time for the 5pm wine tastings they had every evening.

Reviews.Title: “Don't count on this hotel to give you the room you have confirmed in person!”
Reviews.Author: decorate
Reviews.Content: I had booked 21 room nights here for Australian and New Zealand family who were coming and going over a period of one month. Our intention was to have them stay within walking distance of our apt, give them the facilities of a suite i.e. laundry/kitchen and also give them a view of sunsets over English Bay. The best suites are west facing and have balconies. The price was not a problem. I booked the suites in person. I checked on the reservation 3 times. At each visit I offered a credit card as a deposit to confirm the bookings. This was refused. Imagine my surprise when we were informed by a voicemail message on the night before the family's arrival that all nine of them were to moved to one of this Chain's out of town properties- namely Richmond, BC! We quickly scrambled to find another hotel (at a hugely increased cost to us) so as to ensure we were close together on this first visit to Vancouver of our Australian family. After this experience I visited the management in person. Suddenly I could not get confirmation of the suites I had booked several months in advance for the return family visit. But hoped things would work themselves out. Then, shortly before they were to return, I got an email from the Hotel's Sales Manager saying that our party’s bookings had been changed. - One couple had been assigned a “Regular" hotel room. No laundry/kitchen/view and small room. (Avoid these like the plague!) - The configuration and location of the other previously booked suites would now require us to book another suite at further cost! - View rooms were no longer available. - Rooms were now on lower floors close to the bridge or facing away from English Bay. (Avoid lower level suites/rooms overlooking the Granville Street Bridge - noisy traffic.) As mentioned above, the best suites are west facing and have balconies. Of course, if you book them you may find, as we did, that you won't get what you have asked for even if you have confirmed several times. Our solution was to move our guests to the hotel next door (the Quality Inn) It did not offer the "potential" of the views sought from the Executive Inn and had a lower rating. But we found the Front Desk and staff could not have been more helpful even with our late booking and the rooms were as promised! Naturally we moved our NZ family who were to arrive a couple of weeks later out of this property. The Vintage Park Executive Inn's uncaring, inattentive greedy management is an embarrassment and a sad apology for Vancouver's incredibly talented tourism industry. It makes me ashamed to know such scoundrels exist in our city.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location - service ok”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My first visit to Vancouver last week - stayed at this hotel. Room was fine - except had to call front desk to get bathroom lights on - they informed me that master switch near room door must be on first which was a bit strange to me. Internet use available for free in lobby - helped me avoid paying 10 bucks a day for in room use - if I had to print something or download a file that would have caused me to pay the in room fee. Concierges were helpful. Front desk staff less so. Big hassle taking my credit card at checkout. Hallway was very hot - cleaning staff wasn't interested in remedying this concern for me. Again, no major concerns but I will try a different place if I get back to this GREAT city again.

Reviews.Title: “Small Rooms but great whirlpool bath”
Reviews.Author: rchilde
Reviews.Content: My first impression of this hotel was pretty high, from the pics in their web site to the location in Downtown South, Vancouver - I figured the hotel should be pretty upscale. My second impression upon arrival was - well, this seems like your typical boutique hotel in downtown Vancouver; intimate, tastefully urban, and well planned. We checked into our room and both my fiance and I were quite surprised about the size of the room. Sure, we have stayed in much smaller rooms in downtown Vancouver but we selected a superiour room which was supposed to be the middle offering of their room selection. But the room seemed remotely reminiscent of those found at the Empire Landmark hotel with the noteable exception that these rooms have better albeit still aging fixtures. Nonetheless, my fiance selected this hotel because of the whirlpool bath which was very nice! We were not dissappointed beside a few exceptions. 1) plan on 30 minutes to fill the whirlpool. The water comes out very slowly, which sort of ruins the romantic mood that one otherwise would expect to enjoy with such an amenity. 2) be patient with the room thermostat. Once you select your temperature, the HVAC unit takes its time to "fire-up." I did not know this and sware I spent 10 minutes trying to get the thing on, as the room was very stuffy upon arrival (it was a nice sunny spr/ummer day). It does eventually come on and worked fine. 3) No movie selection here. I mean, come on .. no typical movie channels or even good pay per view selection. It appears their entertainment system was manufactured during the early 1990s as its not very modern. One would ask why this would matter in a world class city like Vancouver, where there is soooo much to do. Well, when you return to the hotel after doing the Van City you might want to see a private movie (no dirty thoughts!!!). Poor selection and it is not "on demand," as you wait for the time the movie will show. It has been years if not decades since the last time I've seen such an antiquated entertainment option. 4) The front desk seemed quite surprised to have guests during my visit. When I checked in, he seemed rather amazed that I selected his hotel. After experiencing the above 3 comments, I now realize why he might think this. My fiance and I frequent Vancouver BC very often, as we live in the Seattle area and going up to the big city is "nothing" for us. We often stay at more expensive, higher class hotels but she wanted to try a more budget option with a whirlpool bath ensuite, hence our stay here. But the front desk did not have the usual dimeanor of most Vancouver hotels as he was not very hospitable nor did he suck-up to us. We love these things and often tip people who make us feel welcome and special, so his behaviour was a disappointment. Beyond those special notes, if you're on a budget and want a quieter place to stay downtown this place will not let you down. We had a terrific view of English Bay and the West End and the nightlife was hardly noticeable near the hotel; quite a surprise since this is downtown Vancouver where nightlife is abundant everywhere, all-of-the-time. And the whirlpool bath did live up to our expectations. We loved it and even used it as a benchmark for our future purchase of one. We did not like the fact that the shower was also there (not separate) but hey I did say this was a small hotel room, you know. One final note, I noticed that the entertainment system had a channel for tourism Vancouver. Im not sure if every hotel has this channel now (as I dont recall the channel on my last visit to Vancouver at a different hotel in Jan 2005) but THIS CHANNEL is world class, well done, and very attractive especially for the tourist to Vancouver. I learned much about the city and I have been coming here for years now. And the tone of the channel and its commercials are sexy, sophisticated, artistic, and modern - just like Downtown Vancouver itself. I must commend Tourism Vancouver for the channel and must emai them also. Of course, downtown Vancouver was awesome. In fact, we had more fun during this visit than probably any other vacation we have been on. Perhaps this is the reason for my rating the hotel as above average, I mean I did have a nice sleep, conducted my business downtown successfully, and my fiance had a lovely time. But I must be honest that we probably will not stay here again due to the above issues unless my fiance has a desire to stay in these budget accomodations again, with a private whirlpool bath.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Amy50
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful stay here! The staff couldn't have been more helpful and the location was perfect! I'm really surprized at the two reviews before mine, because it's as if they're talking about a different hotel. I plan on visiting again next summer!

Reviews.Title: “Stop - Horrible experience - Read this”
Reviews.Author: flyguy
Reviews.Content: We booked 7 rooms with the Executive Inn and nothing was right from the moment the first person arrived. They lost one persons entire reservation and booked them next door (which I wish we were all in after this experience) with no apologies. We were on our way to the Port of Vancouver for a glorious 7 day cruise. The hotel promised that they would transfer us with their complimentary van. They would not take us to the port and we had to hire two vans. We even offered to pay one of the drivers to take us. No the van stayed at the hotel. Our rooms were so small and uncomfortable we had to pile luggage on top of each other just to move around the room. We had one room that we were told was wheel chair ready and they had nothing of the sort. They had to run out to the store and buy some transfer equipment. It was misereable. Where was Albert, the one who promised us everything was taken care of. Once there, they tried to bump the price. We found the staff to be very short and not accommodating at all. Coming from the Florida Keys and a huge tourist area, I would not be in business if I treated people like this. Just to top it all off. When we got home and got the bill in for the 3 nights we stayed there, they charged me $30.00 more for the room than my daughters room. We had the same small room and we were all suppose to get the group rate. We found this to be a total rip off. They lied about the rooms, just to get our business. Please avoid this place at all costs.

HotelInfo.Name: Executive Hotel Vintage Park
HotelInfo.Address: 1379 Howe Street, Vancouver, British Columbia V6Z 2R5, Canada
